title: Chocolate Chip Muffins
description: Soft, moist muffins made without eggs or dairy.
ingredients: 1 cup mini vegan chocolate chips (170 g)
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Mix the flour, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.
Add wet ingredients and gently combine. Make sure not to over mix the batter!
Gently fold in chocolate chips.
Fill muffin tins to the top, sprinkle extra chips, and bake for around 20 mins, or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean!

title: Double Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Chewy and chocolatey vegan cookies with a rich cocoa base. These are honestly probably the only cookie I have ever perfected and they come out amazing every. single. time.
ingredients: 1/2 tsp espresso powder (optional, but highly recommended)
1 cup (170 g) vegan chocolate chips or however many your heart desires :)
steps: Before you start, I highly recommend using a kitchen scale for measuring out the ingredients!
In a bowl, whisk together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, and espresso powder. Set this bowl aside.
In a separate bowl, cream the softened vegan butter with brown sugar and granulated sugar for around 3 minutes using a mixer. Slowly add in the vanilla and apple sauce until well combined.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet, mixing with a wooden spoon gently until a dough forms.
Fold in the chocolate chips or chunks. I recommend using 2 types for a nice variety, Trader Joes has an excellent selection.
Optional: Put the dough in the fridge for around 2 hours. This step isn't necesarry, but I've noticed the cookies do come out more flavorful and gooey when refigerated before baking.
Scoop the cookie dough onto the baking sheet, roughly the size of 2 tablespoons per cookie and bake for 10–12 minutes, or until you can tell they are done!
Let cookies cool for about 10 minutes and then enjoy :)

title: Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Soft and chewy chocolate chip cookies made gluten-free with oat flour! I make these for my gluten-free friends and they absolutely adore them! Most can't even tell they are gluten free besides the subtle oat taste, but that could easily be replaced with 1:1 gluten free flour, I just like using the oat flour tbh.
ingredients: 1 tbsp (10 g) arrowroot starch (or corn/potato starch)
1/2 cup (113 g) salted vegan butter, melted
1 cup (170 g) vegan chocolate chips or however many your heart desires :)
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, whisk together oat flour, arrowroot starch, baking powder, and baking soda.
In a separate bowl, cream together the melted vegan butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar for about 3 minutes.
Stir in the dairy-free yogurt and vanilla extract into the sugar/butter mixture until combined.
Gradually mix the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients to form a dough. I recommend using a wooden spoon.
Fold in chocolate chips or chunks.
Optional: Put the dough in the fridge for around 2 hours. This step isn't necesarry, but I've noticed the cookies do come out more flavorful and gooey when refigerated before baking.
Scoop the cookie dough onto the baking sheet, roughly the size of 2 tablespoons per cookie and bake for 10–12 minutes, or until edges are golden brown.
Let cookies cool for about 10 minutes and then enjoy :)

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Chewy vegan chocolate chip cookies made with no eggs. It took me about 10 years to master this chocolate chip cookie recipe. I have made so many modifications it's not even funny. However, these take the cake for now, but I trust I will come up with a new and improved recipe soon :)
ingredients: 1 tbsp (10 g) arrowroot starch (or corn/potato starch)
2/3 cup (150 g) salted vegan butter, melted
1 cup (170 g) vegan chocolate chips or however many your heart desires :)
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, cornstarch, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.
In a large bowl, beat the melted vegan butter with brown sugar and granulated sugar until fluffy.
Add applesauce/yogurt and vanilla extract to the sugar/butter mixture and stir to combine.
Slowly add the dry ingredients into the wet mixture until a dough forms. I recommend using a wooden spoon.
Fold in the chocolate chips.
Optional: Put the dough in the fridge for around 2 hours. This step isn't necesarry, but I've noticed the cookies do come out more flavorful and gooey when refigerated before baking.
Scoop the cookie dough onto the baking sheet, roughly the size of 2 tablespoons per cookie and bake for 10–12 minutes, or until until edges are golden brown.
Let cookies cool for about 10 minutes and then enjoy :)

title: Funfetti Sugar Cookies
description: Chewy in the middle, crispy on the outside, fun sugar cookies!
ingredients: 1/4 cup (60 g) applesauce (or ~60 g dairy-free yogurt)
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cornstarch, salt, sprinkles in a medium-sized bowl. Set aside.
Cream the melted butter, sugar, applesauce, and vanilla until smooth, no clumps. For about 3 minutes.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry and gently combine. Make sure not to over mix the batter! I recommend using a wooden spoon.
Fold in sprinkles, however many you would like honestly.
Optional: Put the dough in the fridge for around 2 hours. This step isn't necesarry, but I've noticed the cookies do come out more flavorful and gooey when refigerated before baking.
Scoop the cookie dough onto the baking sheet, roughly the size of 2 tablespoons per cookie and bake for 10–12 minutes, or until edges are golden brown.
Let cookies cool for about 10 minutes and then enjoy :)

title: Ginger Snap Cookies
description: Chewy in the middle, crispy on the outside, fun ginger cookies!
ingredients: 1 cup (200 g) white sugar for rolling
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F, line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
Mix the flour, baking soda, salt, ginger, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a medium-sized bowl. Set aside.
Cream the softened butter, brown sugar, molasses, and vanilla until smooth, no clumps. For around 3 minutes.
Add wet ingredients and gently combine. Make sure not to over mix the batter! I recommend using a wooden spoon.
Roll the dough into desired balls in the white sugar, and bake for around 10-12 minutes depending on size of cookies. Until the edges are golden brown.

title: Linzer Tart Cookies
description: Fun Holiday Linzer Tart Cookies!
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F, line 2 baking sheets with parchment.
Mix the flour and almond meal together, set aside.
Cream the softened butter, sugar, salt, lemon-zest, yogurt, and vanilla until smooth, no clumps.
Add wet ingredients and gently combine. Make sure not to over mix the batter!
Roll the dough to 1/8 thickness and refrigerate for 20 minutes.
Begin to cut shapes, half of the shapes plain and half of them with a shape cut out in the center. Bake for about 8-10 minutes or until golden brown.
Once cookies are cooled, add the jam to the center, sandwich the cookie, and dust with powdered sugar!

title: S'mores Cookies
description: Fun S'mores Cookies!
ingredients: 1/4 cup (57 g) applesauce or dairy-free yogurt
1 1/2 cups (255 g) chocolate chips or chopped chocolate
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F, line 2 baking sheets with parchment.
Mix the flour, salt, baking soda, and set aside.
Cream the butter, sugar, yogurt/applesauce, and vanilla until smooth, no clumps.
Add wet ingredients and gently combine. Make sure not to over mix the batter!
Fold in the chocolate chips and graham crackers
Roll the dough into desired balls, make a cavity in the middle, and place marshmallow. Bake for around 10-15 mins depending on size of cookies. Until the edges are golden brown.

title: Valentines Day Cookies
description: Valentines Day Cookies!
ingredients: 6 tbsp oil (82 g) / melted vegan butter (84 g)
steps: Preheat oven to 325°F, line 2 baking sheets with parchment.
Mix the flour, salt, baking soda, baking powder, and set aside.
Mix the oil/butter, sugar, and vanilla until smooth.
Add wet ingredients and gently combine. Make sure not to over mix the batter!
Roll the dough to about 1/4 inch thick and cut into shapes. Bake for around 10-12 minutes until golden brown. Add icing if desired!

title: Iced Lemon Cookies
description: Chewy vegan chocolate chip cookies made with no eggs—just pure cookie magic.
ingredients: 1 tbsp cornstarch or arrowroot starch or potato starch
2/3 cup (150 g) salted vegan butter, softened
1/3 cup (85 g) unsweetened applesauce, room temperature
1 cup (170 g) vegan chocolate chips (semi-sweet or your choice!)
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, cornstarch, baking soda, and salt.
In a large bowl, beat the softened vegan butter with brown sugar and granulated sugar until fluffy.
Add applesauce and vanilla extract to the wet mixture and stir to combine.
Slowly add the dry ingredients into the wet mixture until a dough forms.
Fold in the chocolate chips.
Scoop dough onto the prepared baking sheet and bake for 10–12 minutes until edges are golden.
Cool on the tray for 5 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack.

title: Iced Oatmeal Cookies
description: Chewy vegan chocolate chip cookies made with no eggs—just pure cookie magic.
ingredients: 1/2 cup (113 g) salted vegan butter, melted
1/3 cup (85 g) unsweetened applesauce, room temperature
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, cornstarch, baking soda, and salt.
In a large bowl, beat the vegan butter with brown sugar and granulated sugar until fluffy.
Add applesauce and vanilla extract to the wet mixture and stir to combine.
Slowly add the dry ingredients into the wet mixture until a dough forms.
Let chill for 30 minutes.
Scoop dough onto the prepared baking sheet and bake for 10–12 minutes until edges are golden.
Cool on the tray for 5 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack.

title: Bakery-Style Berry Muffin
description: Amazing Vegan Bakery-Style Berry Muffin!
ingredients: 3 : 2 : 1 ratio of flour, brown sugar, and cubed butter
powdered sugar & splash of plant-based milk
steps: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Mix the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.
Add wet ingredients and gently combine. Make sure not to over mix the batter!
Fill muffin tins halfway, sprinkle some berries (I prefer frozen), fill rest, and place rest of berries on top.
Make streusel in a seperate bowl and add to the top of each muffin before baking. Totally optional, but makes a nice crispy sweet muffin top!
Bake for around 20 mins, or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean!
Wait around 30 minutes for muffins to cool, then add the icing on top for an extra touch of sweetness!

title: Blueberry Muffins
description: Simple Vegan Blueberry Muffins!
ingredients: 1 tsp cider or white wine vinegar (or lemon juice)
1 1/4 cups fresh or frozen blueberries (180 g)
steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Line a muffin tin with paper liners.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the non-dairy milk, non-dairy yogurt, oil, vinegar (or lemon juice), and vanilla extract. Let sit for 2 minutes.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and gently fold until just combined (do not overmix)!!
Gently fold in the blueberries. If using frozen blueberries, add them straight from the freezer (do not thaw).
Divide the batter evenly into the muffin cups, filling each almost to the top.
Bake for 18–22 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean (blueberry streaks are fine—just no wet batter).
Let the muffins cool in the pan for 5–10 minutes, then enjoy!

title: Oatmeal Raisin Cookie
description: Amazing Vegan Oatmeal Raisin Cookie!
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, oats, starch, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Set bowl aside.
In a separate bowl, cream together the melted vegan butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar for about 3 minutes.
Stir in the dairy-free yogurt/applesauce and vanilla extract into the sugar/butter mixture until combined.
Gradually mix the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients to form a dough. I recommend using a wooden spoon.
Fold in raisins.
Scoop the cookie dough onto the baking sheet, roughly the size of 2 tablespoons per cookie and bake for 10–12 minutes, or until edges are golden brown.
Let cookies cool for about 10 minutes and then enjoy :)

title: Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookie
description: Amazing Vegan Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookie!
ingredients: 1 cup (220 g) vegan chocolate chips or chunks
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, oats, starch, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Set bowl aside.
In a separate bowl, cream together the melted vegan butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar for about 3 minutes.
Stir in the dairy-free yogurt/applesauce and vanilla extract into the sugar/butter mixture until combined.
Gradually mix the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients to form a dough. I recommend using a wooden spoon.
Fold in chocolate chips or chunks.
Optional: Put the dough in the fridge for around 2 hours. This step isn't necesarry, but I've noticed the cookies do come out more flavorful and gooey when refigerated before baking.
Scoop the cookie dough onto the baking sheet, roughly the size of 2 tablespoons per cookie and bake for 10–12 minutes, or until edges are golden brown.
Let cookies cool for about 10 minutes and then enjoy :)

title: Lemon White Chocolate Chip Cookie
description: Amazing Lemon White Chocolate Chip Cookie!
ingredients: 1 cup (226 g) cold salted vegan butter, cubed
1/3 cup (70 g) dairy free yogurt, cold
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, cornstarch, baking soda, and salt. Set bowl aside.
In a seperate bowl, add in the brown sugar, white sugar, and lemon zest. Rub the lemon zest into the sugar to release the lemon extract.
In the same bowl, cream together the cold vegan butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar, and lemon zest for about 3 minutes.
Stir in the dairy-free yogurt/applesauce, vanilla extract, and lemon juice into the sugar/butter mixture until combined.
Gradually mix the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients to form a dough. I recommend using a wooden spoon.
Fold in white chocolate chips.
Optional: Put the dough in the fridge for around 2 hours. This step isn't necesarry, but I've noticed the cookies do come out more flavorful and gooey when refigerated before baking.
Scoop the cookie dough onto the baking sheet, roughly the size of 2 tablespoons per cookie and bake for 10–12 minutes, or until edges are golden brown.
Let cookies cool for about 10 minutes and then enjoy :)

title: Holiday Hot Cocoa Cookie
description: Amazing Holiday Hot Cocoa Cookie!
ingredients: 1/2 tsp espresso powder (optional, but highly recommended)
1 cup (170 g) vegan chocolate chips or however many your heart desires :)
steps: Before you start, I highly recommend using a kitchen scale for measuring out the ingredients!
In a bowl, whisk together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, and espresso powder. Set this bowl aside.
In a separate bowl, cream the softened vegan butter with brown sugar and granulated sugar for around 3 minutes using a mixer. Slowly add in the vanilla and apple sauce until well combined.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet, mixing with a wooden spoon gently until a dough forms.
Fold in the chocolate chips or chunks. I recommend using 2 types for a nice variety, Trader Joes has an excellent selection.
Optional: Put the dough in the fridge for around 2 hours. This step isn't necesarry, but I've noticed the cookies do come out more flavorful and gooey when refigerated before baking.
When creating the dough balls, place a peice of marshmallow inside the ball and seal closed.
Scoop the cookie dough onto the baking sheet, roughly the size of 2 tablespoons per cookie and bake for 10–12 minutes, or until you can tell they are done!
Let cookies cool for about 10 minutes and then enjoy :)

title: Strawberry ShortCake
description: Vegan Strawberry ShortCake!

title: Lemon Cake
description: Amazing Vegan Lemon Cake with Lemon Curd and Lemon ButterCream!

title: Chocolate Raspberry Cake
description: Amazing Vegan Chocolate Raspberry-Filled Cake with Raspberry Buttercream!
